app

You could first determine the mean and standard deviation of the Bernoulli variable \(X\).

\[\mu = p = 0.37\] \[\sigma = \sqrt{p(1-p)} = 0.482804\]


  1. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=37.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =4.828\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.1\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>0.1)=0.4602\)
  2. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.3148\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}=\sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} =0.053645\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=-1.03\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>-1.03)=0.8485\)
  3. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.398\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}= \sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} = 0.068972\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.41\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<0.41)=0.6591\)
  4. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=22.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =3.8624\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=-0.31\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<-0.31)=0.3783\)
